docs.title: Shop Kotlin Multiplatform 6 in 1

docs.title: Project build
docs.text: The application consists of 6 native applications and a common Kotlin Multiplatform module. And so we have to building them all. I made a video in which you can see the process of building all applications.

docs.title: API
docs.text: Application on Ktor. Normal jvm application.

docs.title: Files
docs.text:
The project uses Material Icons. We need to upload the svg folder to the root of the project.

https://github.com/material-icons/material-icons

Download the zip, unpack and copy the svg folder to the root with the name material-icons After that, go to the configuration directory and rename the configuration files:

mv _app.properties app.properties
mv dbconfig.properties dbconfig.properties

These files contain keys and various accesses. They are loaded while the application is running. Do not forget to change the keys in the prod.

docs.title: Database
docs.text: Create a MySql database and a user for it. We register accesses in dbconfig.properties

docs.title: Building
docs.text: Go to the directory shop -> server -> api ... Application.kt - start the application, it will crash, it's ok. It will be added to the Assembly Configuration (if you want, you can use handles). Then we go to the assembly configuration and add the shared module artifact, which will be built with the application. Everyone can now start it - everything should work.

docs.title: Website / Admin-Panel
docs.text: Application in React. npm starts it as usual.

docs.title: Files
docs.text:
There is no usual package.json. I replaced it with package.conf (for ease of use). Install the hocon-parser application which will turn it into package.json when you run install.sh

npm install -g @pushcorn/hocon-parser

Since there is logic with connecting shared module assembly and launch is carried out via install.sh

docs.title: Building
docs.text:
To run a React app from Android Studio add Shell script to your build configuration. Start command:

find ../ -maxdepth 1 -type f -name "*.tgz" -delete && mv ../../../shared/build/packages/shared* ../ && ./install.sh && npm run start

And to build shared module at startup, add 2 Gradle commands: clean & packJsPackage

docs.title: CLI
docs.text: Normal JVM application. Its task is to perform various actions on crone or everything related to the server. Go to shop -> server -> cli ... Main.kt. Let's start the application. Don't forget to add the jvm artifact to the build.

docs.title: iOS
docs.text: Select the Shop.xcworkspace file in the parameters (shop -> mobile -> ios -> Shop.xcworkspace). Select from the list below Shop, target, and you can start the building.

docs.title: Android
docs.text: You don't need to do anything - Android Studio will find this build itself, except to rename it.

docs.title: Kotlin Multiplatform
docs.text:
Assembly also requires Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile. It can be set in Preferences

Good luck!

docs.text: API for Shop 6 in 1. Written in Ktor. It is used by 5 applications on 4 platforms. Android, iOS, CLI server application, React admin-panel and website. The API, like 5 applications, uses a common module on Kotlin Multiplatform.

docs.text:

Subcommands:

    cleaner - Cleaner files without relations in db
    password - Password update

Options: 
    --debug [false] -> Enable debug mode 
    --help, -h -> Usage info

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
## Cleaning files without relations in db
shop cleaner

## backup database
shop backup --type db

## backup uploads folder
shop backup --type files

## Update password
shop password --email admin@gmail.com --password 12345678

## Update with random password
shop password --email admin@gmail.com
